reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and 1 night in the Hassler Rome. The service, food, and bed comfort in the RlC superior room was better than the Hassler'sstandard room, and 1/3 the price.True, the location of the RLC on a dingy side street replete with graffiti doesn't compare to the Spanish steps, but climbing them to the Hassler gets old quickly.
reviews.title: Excellent choice with one caveat

reviews.text: The caveat is that you must have your key with you, as they lock up and go home at 10PM. Because of a room change, I had no key, thus my overnight stay at the Hassler. The Manager, Toy,offered to deduct that stay from my bill, so I would have no added expense. This level of service is seldom seen anymore, and thus earns commendation, and I will certainly stay there again on future visits to Rome.
reviews.title: A small hotel in Trastevere but big on guest satisfaction.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Le Clarisse and were awed by the wonderful staff they have working there. They could not do enough to help you, from Maria the manager, to Giancarlo or Gloria in the reception area and the lovely young lady in the breakfast room who always had a smile and after our first day there knew exactly how we like our coffee.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place in Good Location

reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: Stayed 1 night in this wonderful hotel. Would highly recommend it to all those looking to stay in a wonderful neighbourhood in Rome. The neighbourhood was full of great restaurants, shops and sites. Front desk were wonderful, friendly and helpful. Very easy to access all the major sites in Rome. Clean, charming rooms, also provided us with a great breakfast spread.
reviews.title: Great bed and breakfast in Trastevere

reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in Trastevere!

reviews.text: This was a Fodor's Choice hotel and I'm glad we took their advice. The hotel is off the beaten path from the crazy, touristy part or Rome. However, it is a quick walk across the river or short cab ride to all the big sites. The neighborhood is really nice...great restaurants, good night life, taxi stand about 100 yards towards the river. The staff was excellent. Gloria gave us great recommendations for places to eat and drink. Breakfast was nice. We stayed in "La Rosa" which was very roomy for European standards and had a nice sitting room. They were also really nice about keeping bags for us while we took a short trip to Greece.
reviews.title: My little charming address in Rome

reviews.text: I was with friends on a road trip. We drove all night and we arrived in the morning to Rome on Dec 26th without even booking a hotel or pre-selecting a short list as we didn't plan to go to Rome in the first place :) - this is what makes road trips so marvelous!
reviews.title: Hidden gem near the center of rome

reviews.text: We stopped by a McDonald and looked for some hotel. We called and booked!
reviews.title: Outstanding location, lovely courtyard and wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd read lots of good comments about this hotel before going so we were really excited about staying at the relais le clarisse. When we arrived, the staff were very welcoming, promised to help us find various bus times and gave us some good restaurant tips.
reviews.title: A bit of a let down...

reviews.text: However, we were put in the new section of the hotel and were very disappointed. We'd arrived quite early so we had waited for the room to be cleaned so we could get some sleep before visiting the sites of Rome. Unfortunately, the cleaning staff made so much noise so that we had to put cushions over our ears and they even came into the room whilst we were trying to sleep. The new annexe is so noisy and you can hear everything everyone else is doing. One night somebody left the main door open so we could hear all the shouting on the streets and anybody could have just walked into the place. For the money you pay, you expect that the rooms are soundproof not just fabricated walls!
reviews.title: great location in trastavere, personal scale and well run

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked various questions to members of staff and we were promised a response later on in the day but that never happened... we never spoke to the same person twice.
reviews.title: Charming but . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, the hotel was clean, the area is perfect and is a great place if you want to find good food and typical Roman narrow streets and buildings. If you book for this hotel, ask if you cannot have a room in the annexe as you won't get any sleep, the rooms are tiny and there is no internet connection - it is definitely not worth the price!
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have stayed in this place twice in our travels in italy. Toy who works there goes out of her way to be helpful. the first time we stayed there the room was brilliant, large and spacious and overlooking the courtyard. the second time the room was very small and we wouldnt take that room again.
reviews.title: Best hotel we could have stayed at...wonderful location, staff, and atmosphere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relais Le Clarisse is a wonderful, intimate, extremely friendly little hotel in a quirky section of Rome. And it's about to get even better!
reviews.title: Like Coming Home.
Not worth the price or the hype
reviews.text: We arrived in Rome jet-lagged from the all-night flight and a bit intimidated by an unfamiliar city of this size. And we a little worried when our shuttle driver wasn't familiar with the address and had to look it up in his big book of maps -- while he was driving!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But once we walked through the door of Relais Le Clarisse, our tensions and misgivings melted away. We were greeted by the bright, cheery smile of the woman at the desk. She assured us that, though we were there quite early, our room would be ready soon. We left our luggage in the tiny lobby and went out to visit the funky section of Rome called Trastevere ("across the Tiber" from the main part of Rome).
reviews.title: Requinte, conforto e simpatía

reviews.text: We made the short walk to see the church of Santa Maria di Trastevere (perhaps the oldest church in Rome), and by the time we got back to the hotel, our room was ready, and we took a short nap in what would quickly become our cozy little home in Rome.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Relais Le Clarisse was very small when we stayed there, only five rooms. By September 2010 several more rooms will be added next door, in addition to a more visible and easy-to-find front door. So there will be a room for you, and we recommend you reserve one. Our room was spacious, the bathroom modern and fully equipped. The air conditioner had a hard time keeping up with the August heat, but we were never uncomfortable. And the simple, free wifi came in handy for sending photos to friends back home.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with Friendly Staff
